content.text: If in the previous part, the interest was compounded annually instead of half-yearly, which would result in a higher amount ?

solution.text:
Compounded yearly = \(_{{5000*j}}_ \times (1+ \frac{10}{100})^2\) = Rs. _{{6050*j}}_
Compounded half yearly =\( _{{j*5000}}_ \times (1+ \frac{10}{200})^4\) = Rs. _{{6077.531*j}}_
Therefore the amount compounded half yearly is greater than the amount compounded yearly.
Note- For the same principal, interest and time period this is always true.
